result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse David Albrecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, the defendant has 4 days of jail credit.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions. Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court.   Bond of $200.00 applied.
Defendant shall maintain at 25 hours of employment a week or as directed by his agent.

The defendant shall have no contact with DD, JML, KDLC, or LDLC or their residences of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  The defendant shall have no contact with Co-Defendant CB unless the agent allows in writing.  The defendant shall not possess any firearms.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request.  Defendant shall undergo a Cognitive Behavioral Therapy/Programming and follow through with any recommendations.
Expunction is available if all the conditions of probation are followed and he successfully completes probation.

timeConds.notes: Ten days of the jail sentence is stayed pending further Court order.  The remaining 10 days are to be served, commencing on or before 11/4/2022 at 6:00 pm.  Huber granted.
